contents.contents: Continue along the “Rue de la Pie” towards the Saint Quiriace Square. Right in front of you stands the Saint Quiriace Collegiate church.
Count Henri the Liberal is at the origin of the enlargement of the church in the 12th century because it had become too small to welcome all the priests and the parishioners.

question.contents: Why was the building never finished?
choices: Because there was not enough building material

explanations.contents: In 1181, Henri the Liberal died, which explained why it was never completed. However, as the choir is sheltered, it is possible to hold masses.
